attributes.description: for tracking the node's identity when working with lists

attributes.name: label-tag
attributes.description:
Tag to be used for the toggle label in split mode.
This prop is especially usefull, if you want to place
your own focusable element inside the toggle label element.

attributes.name: ld-tabindex
attributes.description: Tab index of the toggle.

attributes.name: ref
attributes.description: reference to component

attributes.name: split
attributes.description:
Split the toggle in two parts with the second part containing
the caret icon and being responsible for expanding / collapsing
the accordion panel.

attributes.name: toggle-label
attributes.description: Used as aria-label value on the toggle trigger element.

attributes.name: align-text

attributes.description: Style the button so that it looks good on the current theme's primary color.

attributes.name: disabled
attributes.description: Disabled state of the button.

attributes.name: form
attributes.description: Associates the control with a form element.

attributes.name: formaction
attributes.description: Overrides the `action` attribute of the button's form owner.

attributes.name: formenctype
attributes.description: Overrides the `enctype` attribute of the button's form owner.

attributes.name: formmethod
attributes.description: Overrides the `method` attribute of the button's form owner.

attributes.name: formnovalidate
attributes.description: Overrides the `novalidate` attribute of the button's form owner.

attributes.name: formtarget
attributes.description: Overrides the `target` attribute of the button's form owner.

attributes.name: href
attributes.description:
Transforms the button to an anchor element.
See [mdn docs](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTML/Element/a#attr-href)
for more information on the `href` attribute.

attributes.name: justify-content
attributes.description: Justify content.

attributes.name: key
attributes.description: for tracking the node's identity when working with lists

attributes.name: ld-tabindex
attributes.description: Tab index of the button.

attributes.name: mode
attributes.description: Display mode.

attributes.name: name
attributes.description: Used to specify the name of the control.

attributes.name: progress
attributes.description: Displays a progress bar at the bottom of the button.

attributes.name: ref
attributes.description: reference to component

attributes.name: size
attributes.description: Size of the button.

attributes.name: target
attributes.description:
The `target` attributed can be used in conjunction with the `href` attribute.
See [mdn docs](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTML/Element/a#attr-target)
for more information on the `target` attribute.

attributes.name: type
attributes.description: Specifies the default behavior of the button.

attributes.name: value
attributes.description: Defines the value associated with the button’s `name` when it’s submitted with the form data.

attributes.name: checked
attributes.description: Indicates whether the checkbox is checked.

attributes.name: disabled
attributes.description: Disabled state of the checkbox.

attributes.name: form
attributes.description: Associates the control with a form element.

attributes.name: indeterminate
attributes.description:
Set this property to `true` to indicate that the checkbox's value is neither true nor false.
The prop is removed automatically as soon as the checkbox is clicked (if not disabled).

attributes.name: invalid
attributes.description: Set this property to `true` in order to mark the checkbox visually as invalid.

attributes.name: key
attributes.description: for tracking the node's identity when working with lists

attributes.name: ld-tabindex
attributes.description: Tab index of the input.

attributes.name: mode
attributes.description: Display mode.

attributes.name: name
attributes.description: Used to specify the name of the control.

attributes.name: readonly
attributes.description: The value is not editable.

attributes.name: ref
attributes.description: reference to component

attributes.name: required
attributes.description: Set this property to `true` in order to mark the checkbox as required.

attributes.name: tone
attributes.description: Checkbox tone. Use `'dark'` on white backgrounds. Default is a light tone.

attributes.name: value
attributes.description: The input value.

<link rel="stylesheet" href="css_components/ld-circular-progress.css">
<link rel="stylesheet" href="css_components/ld-typo.css">
<link rel="stylesheet" href="css_components/ld-sr-only.css">

attributes.name: aria-labeledby
attributes.description:
Defines the string value or identifies the element (or elements)
that label the progressbar element providing an accessible name.

attributes.name: aria-valuemax
attributes.description:
Set to a decimal value representing the maximum value, and greater
than aria-valuemin. If not present, the default value is 100.

attributes.name: aria-valuemin
attributes.description:
Set to a decimal value representing the minimum value, and less
than aria-valuemax. If not present, the default value is 0.

attributes.name: aria-valuenow
attributes.description:
Only present and required if the value is not indeterminate.
Set to a decimal value between 0, or valuemin if present,
and aria-valuemax indicating the current value of the progress bar.

attributes.name: aria-valuetext
attributes.description:
Assistive technologies often present the value of aria-valuenow
as a percentage. If this would not be accurate use this property
to make the progress bar value understandable.

attributes.name: brand-color
attributes.description:
Styles the progress bar in a way that it looks good on the
primary color of the current theme.

attributes.name: key
attributes.description: for tracking the node's identity when working with lists

attributes.name: ref
attributes.description: reference to component

description.value:

description.value:
The `ld-input` component. You can use it in conjunction with the `ld-label`
and the `ld-input-message` component. See examples in the docs for a better
understanding on how they can be used together.

attributes.name: accept
attributes.description: Hint for expected file type in file upload controls.

attributes.name: autocomplete
attributes.description: Hint for form autofill feature.

attributes.name: autofocus
attributes.description: Automatically focus the form control when the page is loaded.

attributes.name: capture
attributes.description: Media capture input method in file upload controls.

attributes.name: cols
attributes.description: The number of columns.

attributes.name: dirname
attributes.description: Name of form field to use for sending the element's directionality in form submission.

attributes.name: disabled
attributes.description: Whether the form control is disabled.

attributes.name: form
attributes.description: Associates the control with a form element.

attributes.name: invalid
attributes.description: Set this property to `true` in order to mark the field visually as invalid.

attributes.name: key
attributes.description: for tracking the node's identity when working with lists

attributes.name: ld-tabindex
attributes.description: Tab index of the input.

attributes.name: list
attributes.description: Value of the id attribute of the `<datalist>` of autocomplete options.

attributes.name: max
attributes.description: Maximum value.

attributes.name: maxlength
attributes.description: Maximum length (number of characters) of `value`.

attributes.name: min
attributes.description: Minimum value.

attributes.name: minlength
attributes.description: Minimum length (number of characters) of `value`.

attributes.name: multiline
attributes.description:
Uses textarea instead of input internally. Setting this attribute to true
disables the attribute type and both slots.

attributes.name: multiple
attributes.description: Boolean. Whether to allow multiple values.

attributes.name: name
attributes.description: Used to specify the name of the control.

attributes.name: pattern
attributes.description: Pattern the `value` must match to be valid.

attributes.name: placeholder
attributes.description: The input placeholder.

attributes.name: readonly
attributes.description: The value is not editable.

attributes.name: ref
attributes.description: reference to component

attributes.name: required
attributes.description: A value is required for the form to be submittable.

attributes.name: resize
attributes.description: Whether the multiline input is resizable, and if so, in which directions.

attributes.name: rows
attributes.description: The number of rows.

attributes.name: size
attributes.description: Size of the input.

attributes.name: step
attributes.description: Incremental values that are valid.

attributes.name: tone
attributes.description: Input tone. Use `'dark'` on white backgrounds. Default is a light tone.

attributes.name: type
attributes.description: The input type.

attributes.name: value
attributes.description: The input value.

attributes.description: Label text for the forward button (replaces the icon).

attributes.description: Number of next/previous items visible.

attributes.name: prev-label
attributes.description: Label text for the backward button (replaces the icon).

attributes.name: ref
attributes.description: reference to component

attributes.name: selected-index
attributes.description: The currently selected item (an index of `-1` means nothing is selected).

attributes.name: size
attributes.description: Size of the pagination.

attributes.name: space
attributes.description: Space between dots (dots mode only, default depending on `size` prop).

attributes.name: start-label
attributes.description: Label text for the start button (replaces the icon).

attributes.name: sticky
attributes.description: Number of items permanently visible at the start/end.

attributes.name: autofocus
attributes.description:
This Boolean attribute lets you specify that a form control should have input focus when the page loads.
Only one form element in a document can have the autofocus attribute.

attributes.name: disabled
attributes.description: Disabled state of the component.

attributes.name: filter
attributes.description: Set this property to `true` in order to enable an input field for filtering options.

attributes.name: filter-placeholder
attributes.description: The filter input placeholder.

attributes.name: form
attributes.description: The form element to associate the select with (its form owner).

attributes.name: invalid
attributes.description: Set this property to `true` in order to mark the select visually as invalid.

attributes.name: key
attributes.description: for tracking the node's identity when working with lists

attributes.name: ld-tabindex
attributes.description: Tab index of the trigger button.

attributes.name: max-rows
attributes.description: Constrains the height of the trigger button by replacing overflowing selection with a "+X more" indicator.

attributes.name: mode
attributes.description: Display mode.

attributes.name: multiple
attributes.description: Multiselect mode.

attributes.name: name
attributes.description: Used to specify the name of the control.

attributes.name: placeholder
attributes.description: Used as trigger button label in multiselect mode and in single select mode if nothing is selected.

attributes.name: popper-class
attributes.description: Attached as CSS class to the select popper element.

attributes.name: prevent-deselection
attributes.description: Prevents a state with no options selected after initial selection in single select mode.

attributes.name: ref
attributes.description: reference to component

attributes.name: required
attributes.description: A Boolean attribute indicating that an option with a non-empty string value must be selected.

attributes.name: size
attributes.description: Size of the select trigger button.

attributes.name: tether-options
attributes.description: Tether options object to be merged with the default options (optionally stringified).

---
eleventyNavigation:
  key: Sidenav
  parent: Components
layout: layout.njk
title: Sidenav
permalink: components/ld-sidenav/
tags:
  - navigation
  - menu
---

<style>
  body {
    --ld-sidenav-position: absolute;
    --ld-sidenav-toggle-outside-position: absolute;
  }
</style>

attributes.name: align
attributes.description: Whether the nav should be aligned to the left or the right side of its container.

attributes.name: breakpoint
attributes.description:
The breakpoint at which the sidenav takes full width and can be
opened and closed as opposed to being expanded and collapsed.
The prop value is used in a max-width media query.

attributes.name: collapse-trigger
attributes.description:
Makes the navigation collapse either on
- explicit toggle button click,
- when the user clicks somewhere outside the element or
- when the user moves the cursor / focus outside the element.
The modes are inclusive from right to left:
- clickoutside applies if the collapse trigger is set to mouseout
- toggle applies if the collapse trigger is set to clickoutside

attributes.name: collapsed
attributes.description: Indicates that the navigation is collapsed to the side of its container.

attributes.name: collapsible
attributes.description: Allows the side navigation to be collapsed to the side of its container.

attributes.name: expand-trigger
attributes.description:
Makes the navigation expand either on
- explicit toggle button click,
- when the user moves the cursor over the element.
The modes are inclusive from right to left:
- toggle applies if the expand trigger is set to mouseenter

attributes.name: key
attributes.description: for tracking the node's identity when working with lists

attributes.name: label
attributes.description: Label to be used for the landmark element (the sidenav itself).

attributes.name: narrow
attributes.description:
Set to true if you'd like to have a sidenav which partially
collapses in way, that slotted ld-navitem components are displayed
as icon buttons.

attributes.name: open
attributes.description:
Indicates that the navigation is visible in a viewport
which is smaller than the value of the `breakpoint` prop.

attributes.name: ref
attributes.description: reference to component

attributes.name: toggle-transition-disabled
attributes.description:
Disables transitions on collapsing and expansion of the sidenav.
This is especially usefull when the page content gets pushed to
the side on sidenav expansion, and you want to prevent too many
layout shifts during the transition.

attributes.name: trap-focus
attributes.description:
Enables focus trapping. Accespts a CSS selector which indicates
what is still focusable outside the sidenav, when the sidenav is
closable and open (i.e. "ld-header *"). Use an empty string to
enable focus trapping without specifying focusable elements
outside the sidenav component.

description.value:

attributes.name: split
attributes.description:
Split the accordion toggle in two parts with the second part containing
the caret icon and being responsible for expanding / collapsing
the accordion panel.

eleventyNavigation:
  key: Sidenav Navitem
  parent: Sidenav
layout: layout.njk
title: Sidenav Navitem
permalink: components/ld-sidenav/ld-sidenav-navitem/
---

attributes.name: expand-on-click
attributes.description:
By default, the sidenav automatically expands on click of a navitem,
which has a `to` property or acts as an accordion toggle. You can
overwrite this behavior by using this prop to explicitly force or
prevent expansion of the sidenav.

attributes.name: href
attributes.description: Transforms the nav item to an anchor element.

attributes.name: key
attributes.description: for tracking the node's identity when working with lists

attributes.name: ld-tabindex
attributes.description: Tab index of the button.

attributes.name: mode
attributes.description:
Display mode.
In secondary mode the navitem is less high, displays a filled dot
instead of the icon and is hidden when the sidenav collapses.
The tertiary mode is similar to secondary mode, with the navitem
indented and the dot being empty and having a border.

attributes.name: ref
attributes.description: reference to component

attributes.name: rounded
attributes.description: Applies full border-radius.

attributes.name: selected
attributes.description: Sets visual indicator to denote that the nav item is currently selected.

attributes.name: target
attributes.description:
The `target` attributed can be used in conjunction with the `href` attribute.
See [mdn docs](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTML/Element/a#attr-target)
for more information on the `target` attribute.

attributes.name: to
attributes.description: Accepts an id of an ld-subnav component to navigate to it on click.

  key: Typography
  parent: Components
layout: layout.njk
title: Typography
permalink: components/ld-typo/
---

<link rel="stylesheet" href="css_components/ld-typo.css">

attributes.name: aria-label
attributes.description:
Since b* and xb* variants are uppercase, screen readers need to be served a
(non-uppercase) aria-label (otherwise they will read out the heading letter by letter).
If you're using a b* or xb* variant, an aria-label will be
set automatically on the element. The component will use the inner HTML for the
label implicitly. If you want to set an aria-label explicitly (such as when you have
inner HTML that should not be part of the label), you can use this property.

attributes.name: key
attributes.description: for tracking the node's identity when working with lists

attributes.name: ref
attributes.description: reference to component

attributes.name: tag
attributes.description: The rendered HTML tag. Overrides tag inferred from the variant.

attributes.name: variant
attributes.description: The font style. Every variant has a default tag that it renders with.
